definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

sentences.english: Have I also here look after him that seeth me?
sentences.chinese: 我还能在这里再看到那看顾我的他吗？

sentences.english: Parent with child (age 0-4) is required to assist in child care service on rotation basis.
sentences.chinese: 零至四岁的家长请协助轮流看顾小孩服务。

sentences.english: I have felt the burden laid upon me to have a watch-care for your soul.
sentences.chinese: 我感到身负重任，对守护看顾你的灵命有负担。

sentences.english: May your eyes be open toward this temple day and night, this place of which you said you would put your Name there.
sentences.chinese: 愿你昼夜看顾这殿，就是你应许立为你名的居所。

sentences.english: High mountain or low valley both Lord will take care, believing gets blessing.
sentences.chinese: 高山或低谷主都看顾，相信就能蒙福。

sentences.english: Were they looking after their baby at 9:00 yesterday morning?
sentences.chinese: 昨天前晌9点他们正在看顾孩子吗？

sentences.english: "Thou God seest me, " will be the watchword, the guard of the life.
sentences.chinese: “看顾人的上帝”要成为口号，人生的保卫。

sentences.english: And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God had respect unto them.
sentences.chinese: 神看顾以色列人，也知道他们的苦情。

sentences.english: Entrust yourself to his care, and God's power will renew your life.
sentences.chinese: 你若靠赖祂的看顾，神的能力必要更新你的生命。

sentences.english: When we bless others, God takes care of our needs
sentences.chinese: 我们祝福别人时，神就看顾我们的需要。

definition: to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
to look after/to take care of/to attend to
to make a concession/to be accommodating
memorial tablet in a temple commemorating a deceased father
to take loving care of/to value
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to worry/to be on one's mind
